title: Introduce the vector space axioms for a Hilbert space
content: Here we introduce the axioms a complex Hilbert space, which is the foundation for quantum mechanics and quantum field theory. The 18 axioms for a complex Hilbert space consist of ~ ax-hilex , ~ ax-hfvadd , ~ ax-hvcom , ~ ax-hvass , ~ ax-hv0cl , ~ ax-hvaddid , ~ ax-hfvmul , ~ ax-hvmulid , ~ ax-hvmulass , ~ ax-hvdistr1 , ~ ax-hvdistr2 , ~ ax-hvmul0 , ~ ax-hfi , ~ ax-his1 , ~ ax-his2 , ~ ax-his3 , ~ ax-his4 , and ~ ax-hcompl . The axioms specify the properties of 5 primitive symbols, ` ~H ` , ` +h ` , ` .h ` , ` 0h ` , and ` .ih ` . If we can prove in ZFC set theory that a class ` U = <. <. +h , .h >. , normh >. ` is a complex Hilbert space, i.e. that ` U e. CHilOLD ` , then these axioms can be proved as theorems ~ axhilex-zf , ~ axhfvadd-zf , ~ axhvcom-zf , ~ axhvass-zf , ~ axhv0cl-zf , ~ axhvaddid-zf , ~ axhfvmul-zf , ~ axhvmulid-zf , ~ axhvmulass-zf , ~ axhvdistr1-zf , ~ axhvdistr2-zf , ~ axhvmul0-zf , ~ axhfi-zf , ~ axhis1-zf , ~ axhis2-zf , ~ axhis3-zf , ~ axhis4-zf , and ~ axhcompl-zf respectively. In that case, the theorems of the Hilbert Space Explorer will become theorems of ZFC set theory. See also the comments in ~ axhilex-zf .

blocks.name: ax-hilex
blocks.content: This is our first axiom for a complex Hilbert space, which is the foundation for quantum mechanics and quantum field theory. We assume that there exists a primitive class, ` ~H ` , which contains objects called vectors. (Contributed by NM, 16-Aug-1999.) (New usage is discouraged.)

blocks.name: ax-hfvadd
blocks.content: Vector addition is an operation on ` ~H ` . (Contributed by NM, 16-Aug-1999.) (New usage is discouraged.)

blocks.name: ax-hvcom
blocks.content: Vector addition is commutative. (Contributed by NM, 3-Sep-1999.) (New usage is discouraged.)

blocks.name: ax-hvass
blocks.content: Vector addition is associative. (Contributed by NM, 3-Sep-1999.) (New usage is discouraged.)

blocks.name: ax-hv0cl
blocks.content: The zero vector is in the vector space. (Contributed by NM, 29-May-1999.) (New usage is discouraged.)

blocks.name: ax-hvaddid
blocks.content: Addition with the zero vector. (Contributed by NM, 16-Aug-1999.) (New usage is discouraged.)

blocks.name: ax-hfvmul
blocks.content: Scalar multiplication is an operation on ` CC ` and ` ~H ` . (Contributed by NM, 16-Aug-1999.) (New usage is discouraged.)

blocks.name: ax-hvmulid
blocks.content: Scalar multiplication by one. (Contributed by NM, 30-May-1999.) (New usage is discouraged.)

blocks.name: ax-hvmulass
blocks.content: Scalar multiplication associative law. (Contributed by NM, 30-May-1999.) (New usage is discouraged.)

blocks.name: ax-hvdistr1
blocks.content: Scalar multiplication distributive law. (Contributed by NM, 3-Sep-1999.) (New usage is discouraged.)

blocks.name: ax-hvdistr2
blocks.content: Scalar multiplication distributive law. (Contributed by NM, 30-May-1999.) (New usage is discouraged.)

blocks.name: ax-hvmul0
blocks.content: Scalar multiplication by zero. We can derive the existence of the negative of a vector from this axiom (see ~ hvsubid and ~ hvsubval ). (Contributed by NM, 29-May-1999.) (New usage is discouraged.)
